identified-content.person: JACKSON, DR. WYNN ANN KUTZSCHBACH (DR. WYNN ANN KUTZSCHBACH KNOPF)

block.p: Dr. Wynn Ann Kutzschbach Jackson and Prof. John Donald Knopf were married yesterday at the Homestead Inn in Greenwich, Conn. William R. Ferenc, a justice of the peace of Greenwich, officiated.

Dr. Jackson-Knopf, 48, is a psychiatrist and psychoanalyst in Greenwich and an assistant clinical professor of psychiatry at Columbia University in New York. A graduate of the University of Oklahoma, she received an M.D. from the University of Chicago and a certificate in psychoanalysis from Columbia. She is a daughter of Elizabeth and Buddy H. Kutzschbach of Bartlesville, Okla. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.
Dr. Wynn Ann Kutzschbach Jackson and Prof. John Donald Knopf were married yesterday at the Homestead Inn in Greenwich, Conn. William R. Ferenc, a justice of the peace of Greenwich, officiated.

Dr. Jackson-Knopf, 48, is a psychiatrist and psychoanalyst in Greenwich and an assistant clinical professor of psychiatry at Columbia University in New York. A graduate of the University of Oklahoma, she received an M.D. from the University of Chicago and a certificate in psychoanalysis from Columbia. She is a daughter of Elizabeth and Buddy H. Kutzschbach of Bartlesville, Okla. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

Professor Knopf, 45, is an assistant professor of finance at Pace University in New York and an adjunct assistant professor of finance at New York University. A graduate of Ithaca College, he received an M.B.A. from Loyola College in Baltimore and a Ph.D. in finance from N.Y.U. He is a son of the late Marianne Sigrid Carleson Arway and Henry A. Knopf.
